title: Analysis of f from graph of f'

content.question:
The figure above shows the graph of f′, the derivative of a function f. The domain of f is the set of all real numbers x such that −10 ≤ x ≤ 10.

(a) For what values of x does the graph of f have a horizontal tangent?

frqParts.text:
The figure above shows the graph of f′, the derivative of a function f. The domain of f is the set of all real numbers x such that −10 ≤ x ≤ 10.

(a) For what values of x does the graph of f have a horizontal tangent?

(b) For what values of x in the interval <math> <mrow> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mo> − </mo> <mn> 10 </mn> <mo> , </mo> <mn> 10 </mn> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> does f have a relative maximum? Justify your answer
(c) For what values of x is the graph of f concave downwards?

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
